alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 1:31PM PST until January 13 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Snohomish River At Snohomish affecting Snohomish County. Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. Snoqualmie River Near Carnation affecting King County .The Snohomish River will continue to decrease through Friday. The Snoqualmie river will continue to decrease and will fall below flood stage late this evening. The Chehalis River at Porter will continue to rise slightly, cresting later tonight before gradually decreasing. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Snohomish River At Snohomish. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, the Snohomish River will cause minor flooding of lowlands not protected by levees and on the Old Snohomish-Monroe highway. A stage of 25 feet on the Snohomish River corresponds to a Phase 2 in the Snohomish County flood program. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM PST Thursday the stage was 24.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 PM PST Thursday was 26.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will continue to fall below flood stage this afternoon/evening. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1000 PM PST.
